website_summaries.verdict: This five-port HDMI switcher with active auto switch capabilities proves that more is better.
pros: This switcher gets top marks for its flexibility, with its five HDMI ports
Simple and quick to set up
Remote control included for easy switching and manual button as back up
Will automatically switch to active signal
cons: Some users report that  infrared signals from other remote controls can interfere with the unit

customer_reviews.title: Bought a different brand and it worked perfect, had to spend a little extra for it ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work. Goes in and out of signal. Nothing constant. Bought a different brand and it worked perfect, had to spend a little extra for it though.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon and Stormie

customer_reviews.title: Great unit! Intuitive in sensing the "live" channel. Too light in construction and moves around with cables easily.
customer_reviews.text: ANTHEM; CONSUMER ADVOCATE I really like the smart technology that it automatically switches to the "active" source. I rarely have to use the remote at all. The unit has worked far better than anyone I have used, and I have used several. The only issue with it is it's small size and lack of weight. When you connect HDMI cables to it, the weight of the cables pulls it around tilting back at an angle, so don't plan on it sitting in one place; display perfect; it won't. By the way, most all of the other units have this same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Anthem

customer_reviews.title: Game consoles were a bit off a hassle
customer_reviews.text: We liked this switcher. It was easy to setup, automatically went to the port when the device was turned on seemed to work great. I have three game consoles connected to it and all but my PS4 would work just fine. It’s like the switcher didn’t know it existed. Tried everything, switched the port, off and on, got to the point where I just disconnected the PS4 and ran it straight to the tv and cable box to the switcher. Then my Xbox One exhibited the same issue. Just came down to too many issues with a brand new product and requested a refund.
customer_reviews.author: anna mullis

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working Properly After 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to be able to plug my Playstation 4, Firestick, and Roku Express into my TV, which only has 2 HDMI ports. I plugged my Playstation 4 and the Roku Express into the HDMI switcher. Everything worked great until 6 months after I purchased it. Now the screen flickers regardless of whether I am switched to the Playstation 4 or the Roku Express. It looks like I will need to unplug this junk switcher and start plugging whichever device I want to use directly into my TV.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Lady 1972

customer_reviews.title: Great for new TVs
customer_reviews.text: Lo and behold, when i bought my new TV it had 2..... TWO!!!! ..... HDMI ports. What the heck is that about? This was the perfect fit and works very well. Seems to have an intelligent switch and knows where the signal is coming in automatically so as long as your TV is on the port where the switch is plugged in, it will automatically power up the port on the switch where the equipment is powered on and switch automatically. I don't really know why it comes with a remote, it's super easy! Haven't noticed any loss of quality.
customer_reviews.author: An Unbiased Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This splitter works perfectly so far. It is great because you don't need to even push any buttons to switch inputs. It automatically switches to the newest input device to be turned on. Then back to the one that was on before when the newest one us turned off. Very happy so far. The remote didn't work at all, I tried the battery both ways, no luck. Maybe the provided battery was just DOA, but I don't really care anyway. Great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hakala

customer_reviews.title: It ends up taking up a lot more space because of the way it is desig.
customer_reviews.text: It looks good & works great. I would have preferred the power supply to be plugged into the back & not the side. Also the output hdmi is on the opposite side of the power supply. The switch is small & compact. But with the power supply on one side & the hdmi output on the other side, it ends up taking up much more space than I desired. I know have wires coming out the back, & both sides.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Barker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for multiple gaming console users
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a splitter first, realized my mistake and researched for what I needed. I connected PlayStation 4, 3, 2, NES, and Atari. Obviously I had to buy A/V to HDMI converters for a few consoles. Item works great and I honestly haven't even needed to use the remote yet because as I turn off a console and turn another on, it automatically switches to correct console. I also wanted to personally thank Amazon users for answering my questions and giving feedback to me to help me make the correct purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: Is it me or the product?
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really very happy with this product. Right now it won't change from individual inputs. It stays on input #1. I have changed the battery in the remote but that doesn't help. It won't change manually. Maybe it's the way I have it set up. I have input #1 as my windows 10 computer, #2 as my windows 7 computer, #3 is the PS3, #4 is the PS4, and input #5 is the Xbox 360. The output in going to the HDMI input of my TV. On input #1 my windows 10 computer it seems to work great. But it won't change channels or input. I imagine that I am doing something wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Pappy

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: This little box works exactly as I expected it to do. I have 3 items hooked up to it and it changes over easily. Picture is as good as if the box were not there. Made switching from one device to another much easier for my wife to manipulate. The only "knock" i might have is that it is so light in weight that it occasionally shifts by itself. I can easily remedy that very small problem by routing the cables in a more permanent way. This little box works very well and I'm quite pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, good looking, great working product
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this purchase. Much more expensive options out there, but this was a small, sleek, inexpensive option that works great. A nice feature that wasn’t advertised in the product description was the fact that the HDMI switcher will automatically select a newly introduced HDMI input and pop it on my TV. It’s super fast and the output looks beautiful. The second I turn off say my Nintendo Switch, it will immediately switch inputs back to my cable box. If the device has a lingering HDMI output after power down state, the included controller works great, or you can use the switch on the device itself to select whatever input you want.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Mundy

customer_reviews.title: Mind of its own
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up with only two inputs. The DVR is powered up and the DVD player is not. Repeatedly advanced to the DVD player which was still OFF. Changed it to the DVR and within moments, went back to DVD. Only stopped when I pulled the HDMI cable free from the DVD player. Tried every port, reversed order and replaced cables. This unit is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Louis FLeming

customer_reviews.title: Great overall unit
customer_reviews.text: Needed more HDMI slots, got this one because of the price and remote, plus it doesn't look bad. Unit seems solid, been using it for about a week now, only downside I can say as of now is that you have to be fairly close to the unit for it to realize you're trying to use the remote, but depending on your living room set up this may not be a problem. Our couch is about 13 feet away from the tv and I have to lean forward to about 10 feet to get the remote signal to reach the unit, not a deal breaker for me just letting you know the remote's reach.
customer_reviews.author: RandomRoosterJD

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for using many different devices.
customer_reviews.text: We don't have much of a use for the remote personally, but I could see it being useful if you're not close to the splitter. It's nice that it allows communications between Roku, game systems, accessories, and powering on the T.V. It also auto-detects input, so whatever device you turn on, the box will automatically pick up that signal and turn on your T.V. All in all, very much worth the money if you're like us with a DVR, PS4, PS TV, Roku, Nintendo Switch, etc all being used on the same T.V.
customer_reviews.author: megan daniels

customer_reviews.title: Partially defective
customer_reviews.text: Writing this review a year after I purchased the product. It never really worked well from the beginning which is a sign I should've returned it but that's my fault. The "switch" button on the device never worked and I could only switch HDMIs from the remote. I could also only switch the HDMI once, then if I wanted to switch again I would have to turn the device off to reset it then I could choose another input. Next time I order I think I will just go with a manual switch adapter and not one that's electronic.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Ferree

customer_reviews.title: Who the heck makes a power light when everything is working fine to be red
customer_reviews.text: Didn't notice the power light was red in the photo, meant it was on?? Who the heck makes a power light when everything is working fine to be red?? Green or blue would have been nice! But not red. Also, you can't switch to an input if you have not yet - turned on the device, no signal no switch! I have to point the remote directly at the switcher, if a little off, it will not switch to the next source. You would think that since it's powered by wall plug/transformer it would have enough power to help amplify the receiving signal. But it works, so for the price its ok at 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: David Eddy JR.

customer_reviews.title: Works well until it locks up.
customer_reviews.text: Locked up 3 times in the last week. Returning it. My old 5 dollar RC switch out performs it. You buy this, you might as well be prepared to fiddle with it every 3 days in which case you're defeating the object of remote control. Looks pretty, the mfg might consider concentrating on making it work right. Edit: I DID however receive a prompt refund.
customer_reviews.author: DrDave

customer_reviews.title: What can I say, this HDMI switch is awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, this switch is awesome!! The best, and most noticeable feature that it has, is its ability to 'automagically' switch between activated and deactivated HDMI-connect devices. The remote feature is quite useful, as well. Remote control wasn't a feature that I was looking for when shopping for one. Perhaps it will make me act more lazily while sitting in front of the screen. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: mll

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, love the remote control. Unit usually changes by itself to whatever I turn on as long as I turn off the other device. This is great because I don't have to do anything. It's also really nice that it DOES have the buttons as well so you can manually change, if you misplaced remote [who doesn't do this?] So far, it has been crucial for my overloaded DVD/P4/Switch/Laptop/Wii situation. Great choice Cindy! Thanks for the reminder to review... :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: 5 HDMI inputs and supports surround sound
customer_reviews.text: I am using all connections for : PS4, DirecTV, Steam Link, Chromecast, and FireTV Stick. I bought this so all HDMI inputs can run through my receiver and get full surround sound support. All devices worked great and the unit has no issues. Picture and sound are both good from all inputs.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: The remote is simpe and works in an excellent way!
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERY Good product - But not an EXCELLENT One. An excellent one would BUFFER every INPUT device and continue to keep each INPUT device active but not displayed. Only one being displayed at a time. The current problem is it disconnects from the un-displayed INPUT(s). This causes the UN-displayed Computer to resort to a SINGLE Display placing all he windows on that computer's main monitor - not good. What should be done is - BUFFER the UN-Display input and not DISCONECT. So, when I select that computer as INPUT, all the windows will be as if I never left that computer, etc. etc. Hence 4/5 - Very Good!
customer_reviews.author: Noel W.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works as intended!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! I got this switch to try and get a handle on all the devices I have on my TV stand - Playstation, multiple Nintendos, DVD player, and cable box. It worked! I've finally organized my cabinet and made it usable! When the first device starts sending a video signal, the switch automatically switches to it. This is super-convenient - just flip on the power for the playstation and it automatically switches. If more than one device is powered on, the remote works perfectly to activate the switch. Again, this is a great product, and I have no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this product
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought, I read the reviews and saw people were complaining about flickering issues, screen going blank, video and audio cutting out every few seconds etc. I thought maybe these problems were fixed and decided to try it anyway. However, the product is every bit as bad, if not worse. All issues happened as soon as I installed it. I packed it back and returned it right away. Absolutely does not work for 4K or any high resolution inputs - tested and confirmed as recently as of yesterday.
customer_reviews.author: ram

customer_reviews.title: essential appliance!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hdmi switch after getting a new tv and realizing 2 hdmi ports wouldn't be enough. This allows my direct tv, blu-ray player and kindle tv stick to all be connected all the time and be able to select the input as desired. There is no drop in picture quality or broadband speed at all that I can detect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent. We have a Chromecast, an AppleTv, Blu-ray and 2 video game systems. This works excellent. Turn one on and it switches automatically. It doesn’t recognize the Chromecast, but the super easy remote and button on the device itself make for a painless switch. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bernhard Hall

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about a cheap switch, but this thing is pretty cool. I have 5 classic(ish) consoles hooked up to it and it works well. 5 in to 1 out with no noticeable lag or degradation in signal. Auto switching to whatever i'm playing is a beautiful addition. It's not HDMI 2.0 so don't buy for a PS4 pro or X box one X.
customer_reviews.author: JonWIl

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly, the remote helps.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace our previous hub. The remote on our previous hub never worked, so it was nice to have a functional remote. The remote is basic and easy to use. The hub switches to the next active channel, so if I turn on the DVD player it switches over to the DVD player. I am highly satisfied and I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Unremote device - Save your hard earned dollars
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to connect cable and two types of DVD players. Couldn't get the remote to work and that includes trying both hearing aid type batteries that came with it. Or am I supposed to buy additional batteries? Also purchased a set of three new color coded HDMI cables for the plug ins. Unsure of what caused my problems as the manual "ain't" much by way of trouble shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Jay S. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Slightly blends signals, but performs well otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says. Remote works fine and it switches quickly - automatically detecting new devices and switching channels. A word of caution though, there seems to be some slight signal blending, with very slight ghost images appearing from other sources. The easiest remedy is to make sure that each device is turned off while not in use, though for me that was a big turnoff - as I abuse it primarily to switch between my video games and the big game. For a cheap unit with five inputs and a usable remote though, I can't bring myself to complain. YMMV
customer_reviews.author: The Nyah-ster

customer_reviews.title: Works great and decent price
customer_reviews.text: The HDMI switch shipped out and arrived on time. We purchased it to add HDMI ports to our smart t.v. Easy to connect and use. We have 4 game systems and a roku hooked to this switch. It works flawlessly so far. The auto switch, switches to any game system that turns on. You can manually switch or use the remote to switch to any device that is powered on. I would buy another one if needed.
customer_reviews.author: LLP

customer_reviews.title: Nice HDMI switch
customer_reviews.text: Works nicely. Also autodetects devices that are switched on and auto-switches to them. Nice way to add HDMI ports when you are limited. Minor negative....at night the blue indicator lights are a bit bright. I have seen way more bright LED's so it's not bad. You might want to cover them up if used in a bedroom. Again, very minor issue and easily resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Maximillian

customer_reviews.title: May not talk to TV...
customer_reviews.text: Product does not communicate well with my new Samsung Q6 LED TV. TV only picks up current source active, and have to reset up source in tv when switched over each and every time. Every time I swapped from Amazon fire back to cable box, I had to select my ZIP Code and cable provider info. Maybe TVs are just too smart these days. It was easier for me to hook up components to back of TV than trying to use switch.
customer_reviews.author: Justin1215

customer_reviews.title: Defective Device That Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this device. Unfortunately when it arrived the remote did not work at all (yes I tried multiple batteries), the switch button on the device did not work, and the device permanently stayed on Input 5. I returned the item requesting a replacement of the same device. When the replacement arrived the remote did not work at all again, the switch button on the device did not work at all again, and the device permanently stayed on input 2. I returned the device asking for a refund. I was not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Reverof

customer_reviews.title: One of the best products
customer_reviews.text: This is easily one of the best products I've ever used. When you turn on a connected device, the switch automatically switches to the device, saving you the hassle of having to switch manually. And when you turn off the device, the switch reverts back to formerly connected device. Very elegant and very well done! The only thing I don't like is that its blue LED indicators are too bright.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Remote broke out of box.
customer_reviews.text: This product lost a lot of stars from me because the remote was broken from jump. Tried multiple batteries and remote never worked. The remote was the whole reason I purchased this model because who wants to keep getting up and down to hit the switch? If seller will send out a replacement remote I will happily edit my review. Other than the remote issue it works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: SGT Diva

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: If you’re having issues connecting your fire stick without sacrificing an hdmi port this is the perfect fit. It has an hdmi port on the top where you can designate it specifically for your fire stick and have all other four ports available. Love this thing pretty good quality easy to use. Only complaint I have is whenever any device boots up it’ll automatically switch over to that device, but I don’t mind it too much.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Transformed my desk from "computer only" to "man cave media center". Love having my ps4, switch, personal mac mini, and macbook pro all on one simple configuration. I especially like how the hdmi switch automatically switches to the most recently turned on peripheral.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Works well and looks good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I have too many boxes hooking into my TV. This does exactly what I wanted it to do. Easy to setup; small and inconspicuous; good looking lights to tell me what its doing and a remote if I need to change the input manually. I have found that the remote does have a limited range - I have issues over ten feet away. That's minor for me since I am still moving around and not yet settled in to my couch. I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Rick G.

customer_reviews.title: Slim slick design
customer_reviews.text: I personally love this HDMI switch. It has a slim design that doesn’t take much room at all. It has a feature that when it detects a signal it automatically switches to that HDMI port, which can sometimes be a minor annoyance when for example your watching your FireTV and you move your computer mouse so it detects the signal from the computer waking up so it switches to it, other than this it works as expected. It can also be switch manually.
customer_reviews.author: drmthrfan

customer_reviews.title: Multiple game console owners - this is the one you need
customer_reviews.text: I have five game consoles hooked up to it because I have one HDMI port that is faster than the others. The auto-detect is nearly flawless with everything except for my Xbox One X. I usually have to use the remote to switch to it - not a big deal for me. I would buy it again in a heartbeat. *Note* - I do not have a TV that is HDR-compatible, so I don't know if it supports that or not.
customer_reviews.author: SuperKlyph

customer_reviews.title: Sudden death!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased March of 2018. Stopped working today . Thinking the remotes battery died I replaced it. However the plastic must have become brittle and the hook that holds the battery tray in broke off. Replaced battery and taped the remote together. Unit still does not work. Will not even switch manually. Last approx 18 mos. not bad for the price. Looking for another with better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Wladyka

customer_reviews.title: So many devices...
customer_reviews.text: ... and only three HDMI inputs on the tv. A little cord rearranging and that problem is solved. What I like is that if only one device is powered on the splitter is smart enough to go with that one making the remote unnecessary. I really didn't want another remote.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Douglass

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality build.
customer_reviews.text: Device looks nice enough. Poorly put together. Back HDMI ports are flush with case however the side HDMI ports are set in too far and makes a poor connection. Had to wiggle HDMI cord for output back and forth to get the blue output light to come on. I am returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nimzs

customer_reviews.title: Kinda janky
customer_reviews.text: It works. It will randomly make a high pitch buzzing and if you walk over and smack it, it stops. It’s super annoying. Will randomly not send picture to tv and then you have to switch channels and then switch back. 🤷🏻‍♂️ I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked great in concept but the devices that I attached were ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked great in concept but the devices that I attached were powered on all the time i.e. Tivo, Roku, etc. so the "auto switch sensor" kept switching back and forth between devices with no way to lock it to one device. Otherwise, the switch automatically switches to the latest device to power on.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B

customer_reviews.title: Weak Remote, Signal cuts out for no reason
customer_reviews.text: We have this connected to 3 monitors with one viewing monitor and the connection from some screens goes black after a short while. We don't do anything to trigger the disconnection, it seems to happen on its own. The fix is to unplug and reconnect the monitor. The remote is very weak and has a short signal, but we switch off the box itself. If I cared enough I would try out another product.
customer_reviews.author: helbard

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT purchase this device. It will NOT work.
customer_reviews.text: This product refused to work whatsoever. Plugging it in caused all of the lights to turn on except for the ones that would indicate you were on ports 1 or 2, those never turned on no matter what I did. The device was also set up poorly, with the output slot on the left but the power input on the right. The cord was also only about 2 feet long, making it fairly difficult to get plugged in. I posted a question asking how to set it up properly but the fact that the manufacturer can not provide you with the information themselves is an absolute joke.
customer_reviews.author: Makayla Garfield

customer_reviews.title: I connect my recording device to it and can easily select which console or PC I want to use ...
customer_reviews.text: This is really convenient. I connect my recording device to it and can easily select which console or PC I want to use and possibly record on. I was able to set the remote up with Harmony so I can use it with the Harmony app and the Google Home, I'm almost considering a bigger one or a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Korundur

customer_reviews.title: Difference between 1.4 and 2.0 versions.
customer_reviews.text: Be aware of which version you buy. I bought the 1.4 version and didn't realize. My setup is for 4k AND HDR at the same time. This 1.4 version does not support 4k along with HDR. Buy the 2.0 version so you can have both 4k AND HDR at the same time. I am in the process of returning the 1.4 to replace with the 2.0 version.
customer_reviews.author: JoeBobWilliams

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed to hook up my roku and DVD player to the TV. There were only two HDMI ports and one was taken up by the satellite connection. This device was easy to install -- once I acquired two additional HDMI cables. I haven't put it to much use yet, but it seems to work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to wall mount my TV and found out that the wall mount bracket covered up all but 1 of my HDMI ports. I bought this switch and it was easy to install and works perfectly. I didn't even need the power supply since at least one of my inputs is powered on all the time and the switch gets power from any powered on input. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: H M T

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and works fine
customer_reviews.text: OurTVs' sometimes-persnickity HDMI interface has neem surprizingly free of any issues with any of the devices (Cable-DVR, DVD player, Fire-TV) "behind" this device. Switching between the device's inputs is near instantaneous. Great bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Bob G

customer_reviews.title: Works, but uses too much plug space
customer_reviews.text: This switch does the job and serves my needs as far as HDMI input/output goes. However, its plug ends on a box, which means you will need to either cover up two plugs on a power strip or spend more money on an adapter. This could have easily been rectified by just adding a few inches of cable for the plug separate from the box. Instead they chose to use up two plugs' worth of space, and so this will get that many stars.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little HDMI Switch
customer_reviews.text: This unit works as advertised. Only issue is that with 4 or 5 HDMI cables attached it is hard to keep this lightweight switch in place. Problem solved with a couple of command strips to hold it in place. Remote is a nice convenient touch.
customer_reviews.author: Paperclip 2020

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I'm going from a Display port to DVI on a quite old display monitor (2007 era). It works fine - no issue - until I run the cables thru this box. Nothing works - on any of the inputs. I would have expected to have some issues that perhaps required powering off the device, etc - but not working at all was not one of them...
customer_reviews.author: RALPH

customer_reviews.title: Good product .. easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says. I have no problems switching between ports. If Xbox is plugged in .. it will only go to that port if it is turned on. I like that there is a remote but also a button on the unit to switch between ports. Helps out with the wear & tear on the TV switching the cables twice a day or more.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Useful product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for some friends who are very picky about wires being neatly arranged and least clutter. With the man of the house having multiple devices that need to be connected to their new TV which had only 2 HDMI inputs, this switcher was a no-brainer. The remote to switch the input was an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, switches automatically, no loss in quality
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, switches automatically, no loss in quality. I can't review the remote because I have never needed it. It switches flawlessly between Chromecast, Nintendo Switch, and BluRay player. It defaults to the Chromecast which is always on and switches to the Nintendo or BluRay player when they are turned on.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a while..  no support
customer_reviews.text: Been working great w 3 inputs since March. Now starting to hang. Need to unplug everything to get the box back to working. Won't change inputs, won't pass ANY input thru. New LG 75 tv, DirecTV box, Sony Blu-ray, and Roku. Worked great when it did
customer_reviews.author: rexxdad

customer_reviews.title: It works great if you need to switch between several HDMI devices at once. I definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I am redoing my review because Customer Support voluntarily contacted me, and freely sent me a replacement. Not sure what the problem with the original unit was, but I have to say I am impressed now with this product. I have several HDMI devices I use and will switch to, so the ease of being able to access anything I want to is great. I recommend this if you have several HDMI gaming devices along with a Blu-ray player. Thank you again to Customer Service for being committed.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Well Made, Working Great for Gaming
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a switch or two before, but they always felt cheap and died shortly after purchase. This one is trucking along and does its job without me having to babysit it or even use the remote.
